p: The textured surfaces influence the contact areas, and further influence the friction behaviors. In this work, the friction properties of different textured surfaces are studied, including different depths ( d = 0.3615, 0.723, 1.0845 nm), different widths ( w = 0.3615, 0.723, 1.0845 nm), different orientations ( θ = 0°, 30°, 45°, 60°, 90°), and different shapes (#-shape, rectangular, v-shape). Before sliding, the tip is pressed into substrate for 0.3615 nm. The sliding velocity is 5 m/s and sliding distance is 15 nm.
